entries: Trygve deals an additional {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage on a critical hit when he Strikes with his light hammer.
bot.name: Smith's Fury

bot.requirements: The beheaded's previous action was a jaws {@action Strike} that dealt damage to its target
entries: The severed head makes a second jaws {@action Strike} as it violently shakes itself, trying to rip away a mouthful of flesh. On a success, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d4} slashing damage and 1 {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.
bot.name: Gnash

entries: These undead inflict rust creep with their jaws Strikes. A creature damaged by a jaws Strike or a Gnash from one of these severed heads must succeed at a DC 15 Fortitude save or contract {@affliction rust creep|Rust}.
bot.name: Rust Creep

attacks.name: bite
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d8+4} piercing plus {@damage 1d4} chaotic and {@disease rust creep|Rust}

entries: The vlorian cythnigot presents its awful appearance fully, and creatures in a 10-foot emanation must attempt a {@dc 20} Will save. Once a creature attempts this save, it's temporarily immune to further Sickening Displays for 1 minute.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition flat-footed} until its next turn.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition sickened 1}, and is {@condition flat-footed} for as long as it's {@condition sickened}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition sickened 2} and is {@condition flat-footed} for as long as it's {@condition sickened}.

bot.name: Sickening Display
Rust Creep
bot.note: A creature bitten by the Vlorian cythnigot becomes afflicted by {@disease rust creep|Rust}, but with a {@dc 20} Fortitude save.

entries: An enemy is {@condition flat-footed} against the Rustsworn initiate's melee attacks due to flanking as long as that enemy is within both their reach and their ally's reach.
bot.name: Gang Up

entries: Knurr makes a melee {@action Strike} while roaring Xar-Azmak's name. If he hits and deal damage, the target is {@condition frightened 1}, or {@condition frightened 2} on a critical hit.
bot.name: Intimidating Strike

top.name: Wind-Up
entries: 24 hours, {@dc 17}, standby
The clockwork serpent spy records all sounds within 25 feet onto a small gemstone worth 1 gp embedded in its body. The clockwork spy can record up to 1 hour of sound on a single gemstone.

Once it begins recording, it can't cease recording early, nor can it record onto a gemstone that already contains a recording. Some clockwork serpent spies contain multiple gemstones to allow for a series of recordings. Since clockwork serpent spies are not intelligent, they must be given simple commands regarding when to start recording sounds. A clockwork serpent spy can differentiate between different kinds of creatures but not between specific individuals.
The spy can start or stop playback of recorded sound by spending a single action.

Removing a gemstone from or installing a gemstone into a clockwork serpent spy requires a successful {@dc 14} {@skill Thievery} check to {@action Disable a Device}; on a failure, the gemstone is undamaged, but any recorded sounds are erased and the gemstone still can't be used to make another recording.
Wind-Up 24 hours, {@dc 17}, standby.
top.name: Record Audio

mid.trigger: The clockwork serpent spy is reduced to 0 Hit Points;
entries: A clockwork serpent spy must use this reaction unless specifically programmed otherwise by its creator; The spy thrashes around and emits a tinny scream followed by a steady ticking sound. At the beginning of what would have been its next turn, the clockwork serpent spy explodes, dealing {@damage 1d12} piercing damage in a 5-foot radius ({@dc 17} basic Reflex save). Its gemstone is destroyed, along with any information contained inside it. An adjacent creature can cancel the self-destruct sequence by succeeding at a {@dc 17} {@skill Thievery} check to {@action Disable a Device}.
mid.name: Self-Destruct

entries: On a critical hit with a sharpened gear Strike, the clockwork serpent spy also inflicts {@damage 1d4} persistent bleed damage ({@dc} 17 Fortitude save negates the additional bleed damage).
bot.name: Bleeding Gash

top.name: Wind-Up
entries: 24 hours, {@dc 21}, standby

The clockwork Belimarius uses a mechanical wand as a focus to channel magical energy. This wand is built into the clockwork Belimarius's chest, with only the crystal at the end exposed. The clockwork Belimarius can {@action Interact} to the remove the wand, or someone else can remove it with a {@dc 25} {@skill Thievery} check to {@action Disable a Device}. The clockwork Belimarius becomes unable to cast any spells except cantrips while the wand is removed.

When removed, the clockwork wand is a magic wand containing the last 1st-level innate spell the clockwork Belimarius cast ({@spell fear}, if the clockwork Belimarius hasn't yet cast a 1st-level spell in this adventure). The spells are placed within the wand while the clockwork Belimarius is created, and the creator can substitute other arcane spells of the appropriate level.
mid.name: Clockwork Wand

entries: The clockwork mage regains a spell it has already cast that day. It must spend 1 hour of its operational time, or 2 hours if the spell is 3rd level or higher.
bot.name: Energize Clockwork Wand

entries: On a critical hit with a halberd {@action Strike}, shards of noqual built into the clockwork Belimarius glow green for a moment. Instead of inflicting additional damage with the critical hit, the clockwork Belimarius instead attempts a counteract check with a +18 bonus against one magical effect active on the target.
bot.name: Dispelling Critical

entries: Zaoix takes 10 damage for every hour he's exposed to sunlight.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight

entries: Zaiox focuses their gaze on a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target is {@condition dazzled} for 1 round and must succeed at a {@dc 21} Will saving throw or be {@condition confused} for 1 round.
bot.name: Cytillesh Stare

entries: The boggard scout unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within 30 feet becomes {@condition frightened 1} unless they succeed at a {@dc 19} Will save; those who critically succeed are temporarily immune for 1 minute.
bot.name: Terrifying Croak

entries: A boggard scout ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} caused by swamp terrain features.
bot.name: Swamp Stride

entries: If the boggard scout hits a creature with its tongue, that creature becomes {@condition grabbed} by the boggard. Unlike with a normal grab, the creature isn't {@condition immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the boggard's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue by hitting AC 15 and dealing at least 4 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the boggard, it prevents it from using its tongue {@action Strike} until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.
bot.name: Tongue Grab

entries: When Theiltemar is destroyed, his bones explode as the necromantic energy holding him together is released. This shreds his rusted chain mail as well, flinging rusty shards of jagged metal in all directions. Adjacent creatures take {@damage 2d6} piercing damage ({@dc 21} basic Reflex save) and are exposed to {@disease rust creep|Rust}. As his remains settled to the floor, the {@spell wall of force} blocking area {@b F14} flickers and fades.
mid.name: Rusting Death

creature.name: Meitremar
items: key to chest in area {@b E2}

entries: When Theiltemar is destroyed, his bones explode as the necromantic energy holding him together is released. This shreds his rusted chain mail as well, flinging rusty shards of jagged metal in all directions. Adjacent creatures take {@damage 2d6} piercing damage ({@dc 21} basic Reflex save) and are exposed to {@disease rust creep|Rust}. As his remains settled to the floor, the {@spell wall of force} blocking area {@b F14} flickers and fades.
mid.name: Rusting Death

entries: If Meitremar's next action this turn is to {@action Cast a Spell} that has a range, he increases that spell's range by 30 feet (or increases the range of a touch spell to 30 feet).
bot.name: Reach Spell

entries: Meitremar can heighten {@spell heal} spells freely.
bot.name: Signature Spell

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: A vloriak suffers agonizing pain when a creature or object recovers from a debilitating effect in its proximity. The first time in a round in which a creature who is affected by a negative condition and is within sight of the demon reduces that condition's value, the demon takes {@damage 3d6} mental damage and cannot Lick Rust on its next turn.
mid.name: Restoration Vulnerability

bot.requirements: The vloriak rusted a metal item with its tongue this turn;
entries: The vloriak attempts a tongue {@action Strike} on the same target it just attacked. If it hits, it deals no damage as it licks away the rust and heals {@dice 2d6} Hit Points (or {@dice 4d6} Hit Points if the {@action Strike} was a critical hit). It can't Lick Rust on its next turn.
bot.name: Lick Rust

entries: A vloriak's saliva causes metal to rust rapidly. If it succeeds at a tongue {@action Strike} or {@action Disarm} attempt, the vloriak deals {@damage 2d6} damage (doubled on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its Hardness. If the vloriak hits an unattended metal item, the item takes this damage automatically. If a creature uses the {@action Shield Block} reaction with a metal shield against a tongue attack, the shield is automatically {@condition broken}, but no other item is rusted on that attack.
bot.name: Rust

entries: The vloriak spews a 15-foot cone of acid and rusted metal. Creatures in the area take {@damage 3d6} acid and {@damage 3d6} piercing damage ({@dc 22} basic Reflex save). A creature that takes any piercing damage is exposed to {@disease tetanus|GMG}. The vloriak can't Spew Rusted Shards for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Spew Rusted Shards

entries: A primordial envy can detect magical auras, items, and spellcasters within 30 feet.
top.name: Magic Sense

mid.trigger: A creature within 30 feet that the primordial envy can sense {@action Casts a Spell};
entries: The primordial envy's surface shimmers with a kaleidoscope of color that shines out to illuminate the triggering creature. The primordial envy attempts to counter the spell, with a counteract modifier of +12. On a success, the spell is countered and the primordial envy gains {@dice 2d6} temporary Hit Points.
mid.name: Confiscate Spell

entries: The primordial envy attempts to drain magic from a spellcasting creature that it has grabbed or restrained. The spellcasting creature must attempt a {@dc 20} Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Spell Drain for 24 hours.
entries.Failure: The creature takes {@damage 2d6} mental damage and becomes {@condition stupefied 1} for 1 hour.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but one of the creature's uncast spells or unused spell slots is lost, as if they had cast it. The spell or slot lost is one of the highest-level spells the creature can cast, determined randomly if multiple prepared spells are available. If a cantrip is drained, the spellcaster loses access to that cantrip for 10 minutes. The primordial envy becomes {@condition quickened 1} for 1 round, and can use the extra action to {@action Stride} or {@action Strike}.

bot.name: Spell Drain
